title: Krait Explorer 55LY Jump Range, Partially Eng
author: Clever Ape
description: This is a Krait Phantom Explorer built out with what you can engineer with just Felicity Farseer unlocked.

title: Basic Explorer - no engineering
author: Clever Ape
description:
Solid great exploration ship focused on jump range.

Note it's supported by a 2A power plant for better weight for jumping. The AMFU, Vehicle bay and limpet controller should be powered off during flight.

title: Competitive Xeno Combat
author: Mgram
description:
Requirements:
- Be competent in FA-off
- Be competent in Cold Orbiting
- Understand basic Thargoid Mechanics

Great anti-xeno companion ship for competitive anti-xeno hunters. Able to destroy Medusa and Hydra variants due to great hardpoint placements and maneuverability.

Shieldless build to maximize performance and lethal potential.

title: Lightly Engineered Miner
author: Clever Ape
description:
Lightly Engineered Big Miner achievable with just engineering from Felicity Farseer and Elvira Martusk.

Provides a hold 512 cargo bay and 11 active collector limpets

title: Wing Support Fighter; Heals/Repairs and collector.
author: Clever Ape

title: PvP Mine Bomber Build.
author: LOKIOO42
description:
Hull Tank Mine Bomber.

A wing of these will fill the sky with mines crashing into an opponent smashing them with explosives and keeping them from jumping away.

title: G3 Canyon Racing w/ Dirty Drag Enhanced drives
author: LOKIOO42

title: Basic Combat Krait with Fighter + Collector
author: Clever Ape

title: Introduction to Xeno Combat
author: LordAn00bis
description: No engineering, works well with scouts and cyclops.

title: Pure Hull Tank with 10k Hull
author: Clever Ape
description:
High end Hull tanking Chieftain.

No Shield,
10k Hull and Chaff are used to keep you alive. Guardian Module Reinforcement and 
Lifesupport engineering in place to keep your internals operational with a AMFU.

Uses some multicannons set with incindiary rounds to take down shields on the Class 2 and 2/3 Class 1 Slots.

title: High End Engineered Mining Cutter
author: Clever Ape
description:
High end badass mining cutter.

Note: It's worth leaving a 5A Fuel Scoop and 5H Guardian Frame Shift booster at a nearby station or carrier. When it is time sell swap out a pair of your collector limpets for those to bring your jump range up for going to sell.

title: 256 Cargo Hauler
author: Clever Ape
description:
Cargo Hauler intended to land on medium landing pads to ferry things from a carrier or do smaller trade hops.

Could pair well with a big mining ship + carrier for drop of LTD's at high demand Medium landing pad stations. Fill up a big cargo hold on mining, use this to ferry it all for sale.

title: Combat Collecter for engineering Mats
author: Clever Ape
description:
Achievable with only 3 Engineers (Farseer, Tod the Blaster and Elvira).

The intent is for players trying to get a leg up in combat to use this alongside veterans and scoop all the engineering materials as the fights progress. Carries 64 Limpets with a 5A collector for this purpose.

title: Wing Fighter with Efficient Heal Beams
author: Clever Ape
description:
Efficient Heal Beams used for keeping your Wing Buddies Shields up.

While Long Range Regen Beams would be better it just overheats too much in that configuration as the FDL is a heater ship.

Could be done with Long Range G3 Heal Beams and keeping FSD offline in combat while watching heat.

Power plant is sized for lower heat as well with this build in mind.

title: Jumpaconda (77 Ly) with a ~1000 MJ shield
author: Clever Ape
description: Utilizes a 3A Prismatic shield and E Rated shield boosters to have a solid shield while maintaining a 77 LY jump range with all the fixings. Massively engineered build.

title: Solo PVE Combat
author: Clever Ape
description:
Relies on an Overcharged G2 Power plant + a pair of G3 Long Beams with Thermal Vent to keep it cool while fighting.

You will have to watch your weapon power a bit when you fire all weapons continuously but it's very managable.

title: General AspX Explorer Unengineered
author: Clever Ape
description: Damn good starting Explorer Build focusing on jump range. However given the available internal slots one may want to consider the Krait Phantom instead.

title: HGE specialized farmer w/ Engineering (Max)
author: IM2D
description: This build is shieldless.

title: Fast Bubble Taxi and HGE Salvage
author: Clever Ape
description:
Very Fast Bubble Hopper; Built for Speed and quick turning to grab High Grade Emissions quickly.

-Swapping the Guarding FSD out for a Class 3 Cargo works pretty well.

Pro's:
-Very Speed and Turning, practically a racing ship.
-High Jump Range
-Ideal bubble Taxi since you can fly somewhere to retrieve another ship and ship it back to you for cheap.

Cons:
-Requires a lot of Engineering
-Squishy, shields are paper and you will blow up if you hit things at high speed.
-Runs a bit hot fuel Scooping so you have to pay attention.
-Doesn't carry at ton of limpets for collecting high grade emissions you generally have to refill after 1-2 sets of filling up.

title: Engineered Mining Cutter for HighRes/HazRes
author: Luisqa
description:
Can remove the Fighter bay for another Collector Limpet

Has a fighter bay to help with aggro and support.

title: PVE Engineered v2.0
author: Clever Ape
description:
Another Take on a High Engineered PVE Chieftain.

Uses Overcharged on the Multicannons for Damage.

Also carries a collector limpet with 4 limpet capacity to grab really valuable engineering materials that drop from killing big/rare ships.

title: Bubble Hopper V4, Significantly Enhanced
author: Clever Ape
description: As previous bubble hopper but with higher focused shields a torpedo pylon and lightweight low power draw packhounds to deal with attackers just because why not...

title: 256 Cargo Hauler, Engineering Optional
author: Clever Ape
description:
Cargo Hauler intended to land on medium landing pads to ferry things from a carrier or do smaller trade hops.

Could pair well with a big mining ship + carrier for drop of LTD's at high demand Medium landing pad stations. Fill up a big cargo hold on mining, use this to ferry it all for sale.

title: G3 Racing viper. Faster than eagle but less manuverable.
author: Clever Ape

title: Type 9 heavy Cargo with basic protections
author: Clever Ape

title: Casual Xeno Combat
author: IM2D
description:
Requirements:
- Be involved with light Xeno Combat
- Must be engineered completely
- Must be able to manage PIPs efficiently and effectively.

For CMDRs who wants a casual approach to Xeno Combat. Great for taking out Cyclops and Basilisks.

Struggles with Medusa and harder due to heat and boost-maneuverability problems. Shields is also the prime suspect here for depleting systems capacitor.

title: Long Range Explorer with 67 LY Jump Range
author: Clever Ape
description:
Fully Kitted out and engineered long range explorer focused on jump range.

While the Anaconda gets better jump range this one doesn't manuever quite like a boat.

title: FDL Endurance 3.0p
author: Clever Ape
description:
Endurance oriented FDL that never needs ammo for its weapons:
- Requires really high end engineering including a trip to Colonia
- Uses Plasma Slug for its Huge Plasma Accelerator so it burns fuel instead of having 100 PA shots.
- Uses Gimbled Efficient Thermal Vent Beams to dump heat quickly and effectively.
- Should only have to go rearm if fuel gets low or you run out of Shield Cell bank Ammunition.
- Alternate variation: Swap the SCB's for Guardian Shield Reinforcements and change the shield's experimental to High Cap. If you run out of shields you run away.

description:
One of the best ships for starting and learning combat in Elite. Features:
- Lots of Hull Strength via Hull reinforcements.
- Light Bi-Weave shields that soak up a bit of damage before dropping but recover very very fast (this is the advantage of Bi-Weave Shields)
- Uses Fixed Pulse Lasers against shields giving new pilots a feel for Fixed weapons that can always hit even if your enemy is using chaff.
- Good amount of Module Reinforcement to protect your internal modules. The Chief's weakness is vulnerable modules, this counters that.
- Carries a heat sink for the few times it overheats from constant weapon fire.
- Small Fuel Scoop for getting around. Alternately this can be swapped for a Auto Field Maintenance Unit for module repair on longer combat runs.

author: IM2D

description: Can leave off most of the engineering if desired, but may then require a different power plant. Ship also works well as a bubble bus.
title: Explorer Diamondback (68 LY)
author: Hatsune Miku

title: Explorer Courier (45 LY, fast in real space)
author: Hatsune Miku
description: Not recommended unless you love the courier or want a ship that can double as a racer.

Starting Diamond Back Explorer. Almost 36 LY range and everything one needs to start Exploration.
- Like most exploration ships it has a strong Frame Shift Drive (FSD) and D rated modules in most other places to conserve weight (D rated modules are lighter then other options).
- Important Note: Uses a smaller Power Plant for increased Jump Range, to manage this some modules are kept powered off during flight. To power off a module go to your right panel (default key 4) and set them to inactive.
- This ship can be bought and assembled in Sanopijcha; Maire City. The 4A Fuel Scoop and 4D Thrusters which are not sold at Maire City can be purchased from the Carrier USC Wastage in system.

Systems Kept Powered off During Flight: When you use them come to a complete stop shut down your thrusters and power these up instead. 
- Planetary Vehicle Hanger: A Surface Vehicle that lets you drive around on planets. There are tutorials on how to do this if you are unfamiliar.
- Auto Field Maintenance Unit: Allows you to repair Module Damage. A common thing to do to boost your jump range by flying through the jet cone of neutron / white dwarf stars which damages your frame shift drive but drastically increases your jump range for one jump. This will let you repair your FSD and other damaged modules out in the black with ease.
- Repair Limpet Controller: In cases where you damage your hull from bumping into a planet or stellar objects (rare but it happens) this will let you repair your hull. Note; You generally do not carry limpets but sythisize them from raw materials while out in the black for the few times you need them.

Other key systems:
- Detailed Surface Scanner: Lets you scan the surface of planets and map them with launched Probes.
- Large Fuel Scoop for scooping fuel from stars quickly.
- Supercruise assist for auto-dethrottling when you jump to a new star.
- Does not carry a Docking Computer so manual landing is gonna be key.
- Carries some E Rated Shield boosters to give you slightly more shield for occasional bumps and bruises while landing.

description:
This is a racer designed for the SRV > SLF > Mothership relay race.

You can choose any Ship Launched Fighter that you desire, though the Gutamaya fighter is recommended.

Meant to fly in wings this Krait is intended to provide a good mix of firepower, maneuverability and support capabilities for keeping your wing mates shields and hulls repaired.
- Class 2 Efficient Heal Beams and Class 3A Repair Limpets for Support capabilities.
- Carries a fighter bay the Imperial Gelid GU-97 (Fixed Beam) is recommended as will keep up with the ship and allow for fighter tagging and preventing enemies from using chaff.
- Uses Bi-Weave Shields for longevity with decent regen.

description: the Pride of the Goliath Dreadfleet the Hammer delivers Death from 0.5-3Km with your ideal range being 0.75-1.5Km and minor wing support with regen beams

Bubble Hopper and Salvage ship for chasing down High Grade Emissions and other signals in space.

Key Features:

- Extremely fast turn rate in Supercruise making it ideal for chasing High Grade Emissions for getting lots of manufactured materials in space. 
- Carries a 3B Collector Limpet controller and up to 40 Limpets for farming significant numbers of engineering materials quickly and staying out for a long time.
- 27 LY Jump Range Unladen and 22LY Jump range when full of Limpets or Cargo.
- Very cheap to summon to yourself from any ship yard anywhere in the bubble.

Lumbering Unengineered Mining Type 9. Meant to be used in Wing Mining for newer players such as USC's Drunk Mining Nights.
- Has 13 Collector Limpets running at once to pick up the rocks quickly and efficiently. This is key having a large cargo hold and not enough collectors means you will spend way too long in the field waiting and waiting for your hold to fill.
- Carries all equipment for Laser Mining aka Basic Laser Mining.
- Amazing 512T of Cargo space.
- Basically defenseless and terrible to fly; relying on others with more advanced ships to protect them.
- There is are enhanced variants with a bit of engineering below that increases jump range, shields, etc.

title: Krait Light-Eng Collector 2.0
author: Clever Ape
description:
This ship is focused on collecting materials from NPC ships in combat and to be achievable with early game engineers. A bit weaker on it's own, it relies on it's fighter and wing allies to protect it. Key Features:
- Lightly Engineered: This ship can be built and engineered with the 4 of starting set of engineers Felicity Farseer, Elvira Martusk, Todd the Blaster McQuinn and The Dweller.
- 3B Collector Limpet to deploy 2 Collectors Limpets at once with a cargo capacity for 64 Limpets. Note; B rated Collector has a larger range then other collector limpets.
- Uses a fighter bay to tag enemies and distract enemy fire off the main ship. The Fixed Beam Gelid GU-97 is recommended for the fighter layout.
- Carries Regeneration Beams to repair wingmate's shields as such it's damage against shields is weaker but complimented by a beam based fighter it will do just fine.
- Uses Fully engineered Multi-Cannons with Auto-Loader and Corrosive Shells for taking down enemy hulls.
- While this ship can be done without engineering as well it will be slower, flimsy and run out of distributor power otherwise. If no engineering is available it is suggested to use the related build of the 
- Variations: the class 1 Module reinforcement slot can be swapped for a 1A Repair Limpet to repair hulls of yourself and allies.

title: Courier Ground Scout/Assault 1.4p
author: Clever Ape
description:
Courier Ground Scout / Assault Ship Focused on being a fast small profile ship.
- Ideal ship for farming Odyssey Crashed ships and ground based signal sources with a detailed surface scanner and 2 SRV bays.
- Incredibly strong shields for a small ship, small profile means it can land quickly and easily almost anywhere.
- Mine Launchers to quickly saturation bomb ground bases while staying fast and maneuverable enough to avoid enemy fire.
- Dumbfire Missile Rack to quickly kill ground troops in Odyssey

title: Courier Explorer/Ground 5.1p
author: Clever Ape
description:
High Speed Courier Explorer with Anti-Ground Capabilities
- Focus is on speed and utility as an exploration ship.
- Has all the fixings for a proper exploration ship with 40 LY except a repair limpet. Hull damage or Losing the SRV will require heading back to a port.
- Mines and Missiles for dealing with Odyssey based Ground opposition.

title: Courier Explorer/Ground 4.3p
author: Clever Ape
description: As per the Ground Explorer but trades the cargo bay for higher shields.

title: Deep Range Grounder v4.1p
author: Clever Ape
description:
Long Range Krait Explorer with decent shields and Anti-Ground Weapons:

- Uses Double Engineered Frameshift Drive to get 70 LY Jump Range (to have it reflect in Coriolis edit the FSD's Optimal Mass to be 1856.40)
- Carries Lightweight Mines and Dumbfire Missiles to deal with ground based threats (Odyssey)
- Uses a Prismatic Shield for more survivability and E rated shield Boosters.
- Carries 2 SRVs for longer term viability

title: Deep Range Grounder v4.0p 1 SRV
author: Clever Ape
description: As per the shielded Deep Range Grounder but with 1 SRV bay and a larger cargo bay.

title: Quick Fill Drunk Miner V2
author: Trubs
description:
This is an optimised mining build for the Python. No engineering is needed but some of the components can take some finding, use inara to locate them.

To mine load the ship up with about 75% limpets and head out to a mining spot, usually a planet with rings. Use the detailed surface scanner on the rings to identify the best places to mine. Head into the ring. Use the pulse wave analyser to highlight asteroids with high value minerals and metals. Fire a prospecting limpet at the asteroid while travelling at slow speed and straight ahead. Move into range. The mining lasers are the quickest way of extracting, set them on fire group one, set the collection limpet controllers on fire group 2. Blast away and release the limpets to collect the pieces. The refinery will then extract the minerals and deposit them in your hold.

Abrasion Blaster: Some deposits appear on the surface, should be obvious from the icon. Target the deposit and fire the abrasion blaster at it to knock off a high value chunk. This can take some practice.

Sub Surface Displacement Missile: Target the sub-surface deposit. Fire the missile into it and keep the trigger pressed. A chart will start scrolling, release when the graph is high and the line is passing a blue block. (Should be obvious.)

Seismic Charge Launcher: Some asteroids have high value cores. These need to be blown apart to access the minerals. Check on youtube for instructions.
